reviewText: WCW is not shown on satellite tv anymore, so Im glad I have this blu ray to watch whenever I want to.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The box set was great and every match just kept getting better and better. It was classic NWA action at its best. The best matches on the set was Sting vs. Vampiro - House of Pain Match and Booker T vs. Scott Steiner - U.S. Championship vs. World Heavyweight Championship Match. DDP did a great and touching memory to "Macho Man" Randy Savage. Just like on Vol. 1 it's still shocking and unbelievable that a company who dominated WWE during the beginning of the Monday Night Wars fell to its knees and was sold by Time Warner/AOL as it was announced on March 26,2001 in Panama City,FL. WCW was another company like ECW and World Class Championship Wrestling that left behind not only a huge legacy and legends but also lots of young talents whose life's and career were altered by the sale of the company.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I got to see and relive the best days of wcw and the wrestling world back  in the 90s there were competitors Monday nitro vs Monday night raw
Title: N/A

reviewText: Due to the high sales & popular demand, what was predicted at the end of the first DVD set in that here is Volume 2 of The Best Of WCW Monday Nitro. A couple of notes here in that "Diamond" Dallas Page returns to host this set & gets more personal here than he did on the first set with his recaps & stories as you saw him get very emotional when talking about "Macho Man" Randy Savage, some of the theme music has been changed to their their WWE themes (Goldberg & Scott Steiner) or generic music (all the songs from the "WCW Slam Jam" album), and none of the matches have been previously released except for one (and even that one hasn't been released in over a decade) so this is not only a second volume but also an "unreleased" set.Matches Include:WCW United States Champion Sting vs. Ric Flair - As we saw in the last volume, they were the main event the final episode of Nitro but they also met on the first episode here. This was the classic formula they've shared for years with Sting going high impact in control with Flair constantly trying to slow the pace down & resorting to be the "dirtiest player in the game" to have things go in his favor. This was an average match but the bigger issue here was not only the appearance of Arn Anderson, who Flair wasn't getting along with at the time, but the controversial appearance of Lex Luger.Sept. '95Hulk Hogan vs. Arn Anderson - Anderson was at ringside with Woman, who turned against Hogan weeks earlier, while Hogan was coming into the match with a bandage over his eye as Hogan was dominate both in & out of the ring taking a page out of Anderson's own playbook focusing on the arm using the ringpost while Anderson worked over Hogan's eye using the ring ropes while also the appearance of fellow Horsemen Ric Flair & Elizabeth would result in an result that up to that time was rarely seen in Hogan's career.Feb. '96Steiner Brothers vs. Road Warriors - Steiner Brothers returned to WCW in classic fashion riding their motorcycles to the ring facing the Road Warriors for the first time since Starrcade 1989. Both teams were evenly matched in terms of their power & being stiff at times as the Steiners relied on various suplexes & clotheslines while the Road Warriors used their own clotheslines & slams & strikes as both teams also went aeral with the Doomsday Device & top rope bulldog. Eric Bischoff said this was a "battle for survival" to the point where one team had to resort to a survival tactic to get away with the win.Mar. '96Jushin Liger vs. Dean Malenko - This was during the period when WCW had officially started their crusierweight division as you heard them on the commentary talking about the first champion in Shinjiro Otani. The action was fast paced from the start with Malenko focusing on Liger's leg using a twisting leglock submission while Liger was also more grounded in the beginning before both men went aerial with Liger doing a top rope dive & Malenko delivering a gutbuster off the top rope resulting in a good crusierweight match. The only negative being the distraction at times of focusing on the other storyline going on in WCW involving Ric Flair & Randy Savage & Elizabeth.May '96WCW Cruiserweight Champion Rey Mysterio vs. Juventud Guerrera - You got the action expected here from the start with both men having such a lucha libre past against each other with various high risk fast paced matches such a being caught with a dropkick in mid-air, top rope frankensteiner, and countering a top rope powerbomb into frankensteiner. The main highlight here though was so many moves coming from a springboard position such as headscissors to the outside, kick half way across the ring, moonsault to outside, and 450 into the ring. As I said earlier, you got the action expected from both men's history against each other.Sept. '96Dallas Page vs. Jeff Jarrett - This was the semi-finals of the United States Championship tournament with the winner going on to face Eddie Guerrero for the title at Starrcade as both men traded momentum before Jarrett got the advantage focusing on DDP's head & neck with various kicks & neckbreaker. This was an average match but the bigger story was what was going on during the time between DDP & the people he told to stay away still giving him help & support he didn't ask for.Dec. '96Ric Flair vs. Scott Hall - Flair was out for revenge for the beat down he received by Outsiders & Syxx weeks earlier and started out in control before he went after Syxx on the outside allowing Hall to gain control working Flair's back & keep it by getting involved whenever the referee was distracted or Flair was beginning to gain momentum. This was pretty much a glorified handicap handicap match as Flair was fighting off both men that only served the purpose of pushing not only the upcoming tag title match at Great American Bash but the issues between Flair & Roddy Piper at that time with Piper not being around to support up his partner.June '97Rey Mysterio vs. Kevin Nash - Rey issued this challenge to Nash after he got involved in two of his previous title matches against Syxx as Rey tried to "hit & move" with various dropkicks & a springboard heel kick to get Nash to lose his balance but unfortunately he did eventually get caught with Nash showing why "size matters" punishing Rey but the bigger story was afterwords when someone closely associated to Rey past made an appearance.June '97La Parka vs. Randy Savage - For those who don't remember, Larry Zbyszko would normally commentate on the first half of Nitro while Bobby Heenan would do the second half but Zbyszko stuck around due to a confrontation earlier in the night with Scott Hall & Randy Savage. Hall & Elizabeth would come out with Savage who all kept taunting Zbyszko at the announce table before going to the ring for the match before later Hall would once again go back to the announce table taking his eye off Savage's match while Savage would be "one upped" inside the ring. This was more about pushing the storyline involving Hall & Savage going into the Bash At The Beach PPV more than anything else but still a nice "shocking" moment for that time.July '97Bill Goldberg vs. Hugh Morrus - This was the beginning of "The Streak" from the end result of the match, the impressive debut performance including showcasing his power against Hugh Morris who isn't a small man himself, and the mysterious aura surrounding him to not speaking to Gene Okerland afterwords & even "Professor" Mike Tenay having no information on Goldberg's past during commentary.Sept. '97Booker T vs. Jeff Jarrett - This was the beginning of Booker T's singles career with his brother Stevie Ray being out with an injury as they traded momentum back & forth throughout the contest resulting an average match with the bigger story being the issues between Jarrett & Debra McMichael & Steve McMichael while the bigger "backstage" issue being that I believe this was Jarrett's last match in WCW not be seen again for two years.Oct. '97Street Fight Match: WCW Tag Team Champions Steiner Brothers vs. Public Enemy - Public Enemy were in their hometown of Philadelphia & went back to their "extreme" route here for this street fight that saw brawling all over the place from in the ring, ringside, briefly in the crowd, isleway & stage, and even the announce booth using whatever they could get their hands on such as the steel steps & camera cables (which you saw what effect that had on the camera) to a set of double tacked tables. This was exactly what you expected in this type of match.Nov. '97Booker T vs. Randy Savage - This was an average contest overall showing Booker T still in the early stages of his singles career getting the advantage causing Savage to resort to the "Madness" using a chair at ringside along with Elizabeth getting involved as well throughout various times in the match while we also get an unexpected incident with a fan at ringside.Dec. '97Rey Mysterio, Juventud Guerrera, Hector Garza vs. Psicosis, Silver King, La Parka - This was held under "lucha libre" rules meaning that tags weren't necessary resulting in non-stop, fast faced, high flying action to the point where not everyone came out of the unscathed.Dec. '97WCW United States Champion Dallas Page vs. Chris Jericho - This was the beginning stages of the Chris Jericho we would see throughout the rest of his WCW career & eventually the man we now know as "Y2J" as this was the first time we heard him say use the infamous words, "never EVER again!" while in the ring suckering DDP in with a handshake. The match wasn't much as it was pretty quick & nothing much past that.Jan. '98Sting, Randy Savage, Giant vs. Hollywood Hogan & Outsiders - This was not only a preview of the upcoming Uncensored PPV as all the men had matches against each other on that PPV but also the first time that a member of the nWo (Savage) would team with members of WCW. I believe this is the first time that only the 3 original members of the nWo teamed together as they focused on Giant & his injured neck while keeping him in their corner triple teaming on the neck while Giant was able to showcase some strength like a double bearhug along with powering his way out of that corner also knocking down all of the nWo & his partner Sting in the process. This was a good tag match that did it's job in pushing the stories going into the PPV.Mar. '98WCW Champion Sting vs. Dallas Page - This was a very interesting setup here as DDP was also the United States Champion making his a rare "champion vs. champion" match with both men also being heavy fan favorites & close friends through their battles with the nWo. Both men went for their trademark moves early only to be shoved off with Page being very intense & Sting being his usual calm self which showed throughout the match like Sting using a sleeper hold to ground DDP while Page went for more impactful moves like a twisting pancake drop. Both men went back & forth throughout the entire match resulting in what was a rare match to get during this time of WCW as it was a PPV quality World Championship main event (based off the names alone) on free TV that didn't involve the nWo & had no interference or screwjobs or dirty tactics in the match. Just two guys going out there & doing that they do best...wrestling in what I consider a "lost classic."Mar. '98Raven's Rules Match: WCW United States Champion Raven vs. Goldberg - Raven took a different approach here than usual as he went right after Goldberg attempting to block him into a corner & even throwing a dropkick before Goldberg quickly recovered tossing Raven into the outside guardrail various times before Raven attempted to use a chair & The Flock but that wouldn't stop Goldberg causing Raven to try to run away only for the fans to throw him back resulting in what went down as "75-0."Apr. '98Kevin Nash & Lex Luger vs. Hollywood Hogan & Giant - Lex Luger recently joined the nWo Wolfpac teaming with Nash here while the nWo Hollywood team had Hogan's bodyguard in The Disciple & recent ally Bret Hart in their corner while it should also be noted that Giant was still one half of the WCW tag team champions with Sting. This match never got out of first gear before all hell broke loose involving the rival nWo groups before Sting arrived & made his decision on where his allegiance stood.June '98Rey Mysterio vs. Eddie Guerrero - It was during this period that Eddie Guerrero had his own group known as the Latino World Order (L.W.O.) with Rey Mysterio also being forced to be a member as well but kept being his own individual instead of a "team player" in Eddie's eyes causing this match right here. Eddie made it clear he was out to punish Rey more than beat him such as launching Rey off the apron into the guardrail, throwing Rey into the steps, stretching him including the Gory Special, and ripping at the mask as Rey was fighting back catching Eddie with a head scissors off the top rope onto Eddie & again off a baseball slide on the outside. You never go wrong with a Mysterio/Guerrero match as this wasn't a classic but still quality.Dec. '98Ladder Match: Bam Bam Bigelow vs. Scott Hall - Bam Bam Bigelow was looking for revenge for being the victim of Scott Hall's tazer while you saw just how out of control the nWo had gotten at that time with Disco Infernio accompanying Hall to the ring. Bigelow easily overpowered Hall with Hall responding with his punches & top rope bulldog to take Bigelow down before Disco being thrown out from ringside distracted Bigelow allowing Hall to attack him on the outside. The ladder came into play from here with both men using it on each other in the isleway, the ladder having a tweeter totter effect on both men, Hall riding the ladder down off the top rope, Bigelow's headbutt off the ladder, Hall's elbow drop off the ladder, a belly to back suplex off the suplex, Bigelow pulling the ladder from underneath Hall, a tazer fight, and appearance of a man who had his issues with both men. This wasn't a classic ladder match but definitely a match where both men delivered some big punishment to each other.Jan. '99WCW United States Champion Bret Hart vs. Roddy Piper - Bret Hart had his issues going into this match as he had been out of the ring for some time with a groin injury as Piper took the fight to Bret who kept going to the outside favoring his groin causing Bret to keep breaking rules with Piper responding with his own dirty tactic. Bret went as far as taking advantage of his injury to once again gain an advantage & even went as far as to go after "a fan" at ringside who Bret had his issues with before all of his recent actions would come back to haunt him. This wasn't even close to their WrestleMania VIII classic as Bret was limited due to his real life injury but was still able to tell a good story.Feb. '99WCW Tag Team Champion Perry Saturn vs. Dallas Page & Bam Bam Bigelow - It was during this time that Raven & Perry Saturn were the tag team champions but Raven was attacked earlier in the night while Raven's ally in Kanyon agreed to take his place only to be attacked as well causing Saturn to come into this title match alone. Saturn was able to hold his own against both men separately but eventually the wear & tear of the numbers game out catch up to him allowing DDP & Bigelow to take control but Saturn refused to stay down & eventually able to mount some offense including Bigelow in a Death Valley Driver. It was a good showcase for the team of Bigelow & Page being ruthless heels while Saturn being someone who never stops fighting.May '99No Disqualification Match: WCW Champion Randy Savage vs. Hollywood Hogan - "The more things change, the more they stay the same" as it was a little over two years earlier that Randy Savage won the WCW Championship at a PPV only to be challenged by Hogan the night after in a No Disqualification match (you can find that match on the "nWo: The Revolution" DVD) & now fast forward here & we get the same result as Savage is one again challenged by Hogan a day after winning the title. Hogan was in control early & was able to take out Team Madness members Madusa & Ms. Madness causing them to get into a fight while being escorted from ringside which threw Savage off before Hogan continued to take the fight to Savage to the outside & the announce table before Savage sacrificed Gorgeous George to get control using whatever he could like the announce table, a chair, Hogan's weight belt, and steel chain. Other men who had their issues/association with either Hogan or Savage did make an appearance but still didn't take away from what I feel was the best singles match Hogan & Savage had against each other in WCW as both men seemed more motivated than they had been in not only any previous WCW match they had but in recent memory around this time.July '99WCW Tag Team Champions Goldberg & Bret Hart vs. Outsiders - Bret Hart was not only the tag team champion with Goldberg during this time but also the WCW Champion & set to face Goldberg at the upcoming Starrcade PPV that weekend but Bret was attacked backstage earlier causing Goldberg to come out & face both Outsiders alone dominating both men before they relied on double teaming to regain control only for Bret to attempt to come in to even the odds but too weakened & taken advantage of because of that. While this match would looks good on star power alone, it was more focused on push a "storyline."Dec. '99House Of Pain Match: Sting vs. Vampiro - This one time match was a steel cage match with a roof in top with handcuffs surrounding the cage with the object being to cuff your opponent & proceed to punish them as Vampiro cuffed the cage door causing Sting to use his bat to break into the cage through the roof. This was mostly just a brawl in the cage with both men exchanging strikes throughout the match along with some wrestling moves like Sting countering Vampiro's drop rope dropkick into a powerbomb as they cage really didn't come into play until towards the end when the eventual shackling & punishment happened. This match looked good on paper but really wasn't much past their usual encounters.May '00Shane Helms vs. Shannon Moore - The former 3 Count members faced off here with Moore having another former but once again 3 Count member Evan Karagis at ringside. This was a very short match that had some high flying action in what was really a glorified handicap match with Evan constantly getting involved on the outside.Feb. '01Title vs. Title Match: WCW Champion Scott Steiner vs. WCW United States Champion Booker T - This was the from the final episode of & a match where the victor will have both championship & the loser walks out with nothing. This was pretty short & sweet as it went back & forth between both men with Steiner using his strength such as the belly to belly suplex & using his trademark lead pipe while Booker T relied on his athleticism with moves like the axe kick & pancake. This wasn't their best encounter but definitely a historical match as it declared who would be the last WCW Champion before the company closed it doors.Mar. '01[Best Of Confidential](Blu-Ray) WCW Champion Hulk Hogan vs. Lex Luger - A week after Luger's controversial appearance on the first Nitro, this was his first match back against the WCW Champion that saw Hogan take a different approach using some wrestling we normally don't see from him like a hammerlock & drop toe hold & front face lock as both men were evenly match as we saw both of them get right back up from the others suplex. The big story here through wasn't just the presence of the Dungeon Of Doom but who they decided to attack...and NOT attack.Sept. '95(Blu-Ray) Ric Flair vs. Brian Pillman - Flair was out for revenge for the man who cost him his "dream match" Arn Anderson against Arn Anderson as this was pretty short with Pillman starting to show signs of his "loose cannon" character while they just constantly exchanged chops both in & out of the ring.Sept. '95(Blu-Ray) J.L. vs. nWo Sting - This was really just a dominate squash match by nWo Sting with the nWo at ringside before the real Sting, who hadn't been seen since he told WCW to "stick it" after War Games, would appear wearing all black with his face painted white & black to get his revenge on nWo Sting before the nWo made Sting an offer with Sting saying the last words he would hear from him for over a year.Oct. '96(Blu-Ray) Sting & Lex Luger vs. Hollywood Hogan & Randy Savage - This match happened during their "Spring Break Out" episode where the ring was setup outside in the middle of the pool as this match was quite the crazy setup in itself as after the actions of Randy Savage attacking Sting during his cage match against Hogan at Uncensored, Eric Bischoff thought everything was back to normal in the nWo & signed a tag match with Hogan against Sting & Luger only for Savage to reveal he attacked Sting so he would win the WCW Title & become the nWo leader replacing Hogan. We saw Savage & Hogan still openly having their issues against each other from the start as Savage slugged Hogan only for Hogan to respond by not tagging in during the match while Sting & Luger worked him over only for Savage to make a blind tag & throw Hogan "to the wolves." This was a very unusual tag match considering the whole setup but did it's job in pushing the problems between Savage & Hogan in the nWo but definitely watch for the amazing entrance Sting made considering there wasn't a roof to drop in from.Mar. '98(Blu-Ray) Steel Cage Match: Dallas Page vs. Randy Savage - Dallas Page was made an offer to join the nWo Wolfpac a week earlier but the only person who didn't vote for him to get in was Savage himself so he made his challenge to prove if DDP was worthy while Roddy Piper, who had his own issues with Savage for the past few months, made himself the referee while this cage did have a roof on the top of it. Both men came into this match with injuries as DDP had bad ribs while Savage had a bad leg which both injures were exploited when they were sent into the cage during the match while the battle got so physical that they turned their attention to Piper whenever he tried to step in causing Piper to have a response of his own against both men. This wasn't as memorable as their previous matches but still very physical.June '98(Blu-Ray) WCW Champion Goldberg vs. Sting - Dallas Page was on commentary as he was set to face the champion at Halloween Havoc as both men started off intense with Goldberg delivering a snap slam & Sting responding with a tree of woe & suplex right off the bat before they traded momentum with Sting doing a dropkick but Goldberg got right back up followed by a tombstone piledriver that he openly showed effects from causing Sting to go on the heavy offense with repeated Stinger splashes & eventually applying the Scorpion Deathlock. This was a quality "dream match" between both men with the only thing negative to say is what happened towards the end.Sept. '98(Blu-Ray) WCW Television Champion Scott Steiner vs. Chris Jericho - This was a rare match in itself as both men weren't fan favorites with Jericho sending Ralphus back while Steiner had Buff Bagwell in his corner as Jericho mocked Steiner early on only for Steiner to respond shoving him down. Steiner grounded Jericho using his power before Jericho was able to start to get some offense using his athleticism like his spring dropkick before Bagwell got involved giving Steiner the advantage including using sending him in the front row, using a chair, and using the "ground & pound" offense on the map & in the corner while also being very stiff with his clotheslines. While Jericho got some offense in, this was your typical "Big Poppa Pump" beating with Jericho also dealing with issues in regards to a man who Jericho caused to have a mentality of "life a drag."Feb. '99(Blu-Ray) Ric Flair & Goldberg vs. Hollywood Hogan & Kevin Nash - Flair was the President of WCW during this time while Goldberg & Flair had their issues with each other based off the previous week when Goldberg had a confrontation with Flair's son David while Hogan wanted revenge for being what he felt was cheated out of the WCW Championship. Hogan was dominate against Flair & kept catching him whenever he went on the offense causing Flair to make the tag to Goldberg as he & Hogan kept getting up from each others offense resulting in double teaming from Nash & Hogan while Nash are more aggressive than usual when locking up against Goldberg before Flair would make his presence felt that was unwanted by his tag partner before Hogan's theory about being screwed would come to light more.Mar. '99Other moments include Madusa trashing the WWF Womens Championship, Eric Bischoff responding to the nWo taking over the show the week before, Kevin Nash talking about the veterans in the business leaving "potholes" for the younger guys, Hollywood Hogan calling out Sting, Hogan & Dennis Rodman calling out Lex Luger & Giant, nWo announcing their newest members...Bret Hart, the birth of the red & black "Wolfpac", and Chris Jericho meets Goldberg with Bret Hart's WCW Championship victory speech & a look at the war of words between Dallas Page & Randy Savage are on the Blu-Ray. Also included is a special highlight look at various things in the history of the show like Crusierweights, Nitro Girls, Spring Breakout events, Nitro Parties, and Celebrities. Best Buy bonus matches include Rey Mysterio & Steven Regal vs. Eddie Guerrero & Dean Malenko along with United States Champion Bret Hart vs. Sting.They got a lot of the moments & matches that was missed during the first set but still left some important ones out (WHERE IS ARN ANDERSON'S RETIREMENT SPEECH!) & some matches I would question why were they here but still a nice sequel to this series with the biggest bonus being as I said earlier that all of these matches were previously unreleased while I also liked the fact that there was more of a focus on the biggest period in the history of the show (1996-1998) and less emphasis on the dying years (after 1999). In the end, it's a collection I would recommend for fans of WCW or the Monday Night Wars period.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A few years ago WWE released a 3-disc set called "The Very Best of Monday Nitro" and it had plenty of good moments, but it obviously barely scratched the surface of the many great moments WCW's Monday Nitro program had. This is Volume 2 which shows the fans more of what made Nitro must watch programming, thankfully Diamond Dallas Page is hosting again and offers more honest takes on how good WCW was in it's heyday.Disc 1-9/4/95, WCW United States Championship Match, Ric Flair vs. Sting (Champion): From the very first Nitro broadcast, but before the match Lex Luger (who just left WWE the night before) comes down the entrance way much to the shock of the fans and the announcers, then leaves. Flair wears down Sting while the Stinger comes back using his strength and also hits some high flying moves, though a splash from the top doesn't pay off. Arn Anderson comes down to ringside, later Ric locks on the figure four, grabs the ropes and doesn't break at 5 so the ref DQ's him. 6/10, Arn attacks Ric and runs him off (building up their match at Fall Brawl), also there's a face/off between Scott Norton and Randy Savage to close out the segment.-12/18/95, Madusa Trashes The WWE Women's Championship: Madusa while still the WWE Women's champion comes onto Nitro, talks about being champion, grabs the actual belt and dumps it in the trash. Decent segment.-2/12/96, Hulk Hogan vs. Arn Anderson w/Woman: After losing the World Title the previous night and suffering an eye injury, Hulk was out for revenge and took it to Anderson with power moves, and works on the shoulder slamming it into the ring post. Ric Flair and Miss Elizabeth come down to the ring, Arn does get in some shots, even hits the Spinebuster but Hulk kicks out. Hogan ends up locking on the Figure Four on Arn, even fends off Flair, but gets powder in the eye from Woman. Arn hits Hulk with one of Elizabeth's shoes and covers to win. 6/10. Hogan does attack both guys, Macho Man comes down to help fight them off.-3/11/96, Steiner Brothers vs. Road Warriors: Two powerhouse teams face off in a true dream match (I do recall their '89 Starrcade match being good but short though), both teams trade momentum and each guy hit some impressive power moves. After the Doomsday Device, Scott breaks up the pin, we get a series of flying clotheslines, Rick hits a diving bulldog but gets hit with a spiked pad and is covered by Hawk for the win. 8/10. Nice post match promo by Scott.-5/6/96, Jushin "Thunder" Liger vs. Dean Malenko: A real dream match of mine as these two were both favorites of mine, especially Liger who just had a great look and moveset. Unfortunately this is a pretty short contest, there's some good wrestling by both guys, Liger shows off his leaping abilty a few times, hitting a nice splash from the top to the outside. Dean does work on the leg of Liger, with a nice leg lock, Malenko hits a Gutbuster off the second rope, then a sit out powerbomb for three. 6/10, cause the cameras seemed more focused on Ric Flair and his ladies at one point during the match (added nothing to what was going on in the ring).-9/16/96, WCW Cruiserweight Championship Match, Rey Mysterio (Champion) vs. Juventud Guerrera: Two rivals from their Mexico days face off in this good but again another short contest, some great mat wrestling and high flying move from both. Nice dropkick by Rey catching Juvi on the way down, Juvi comes back with a jumping spin kick and a moonsault off the second rop to the outside. Juvi keeps up the offense but gets hit with a hurricarana from the top and Mysterio covers to retain his title. 7/10.-9/30/96, Eric Bischoff's Biggest Regret: We get a promo from Eric talking about WCW and the long term history of the company through the years. Good stuff here.-12/9/96, WCW United States Championship Tournament Quarter Finals, Diamond Dallas Page vs. Jeff Jarrett: Good match here as both men kept showing up the other on occasion, also some good wrestling displayed with the expected dirty tactics by Jeff, who does shine in this match at times. DDP kept fighting back, hitting a nice discus clothesline, a nice diving clothesline off the top. Nash and Hall come down, Hall hits the Outsider Edge on Jeff while the ref is distracted, DDP never seein this comes in and covers to win. 7/10.-4/21/97, Kevin Nash Patches Up Potholes: Members of the NWO lead by Kevin Nash come down to the ring and cut a promo, Syxx runs down Ric Flair and Roddy Piper first, Nash then runs them down with some good lines.-5/26/97, Hollywood Hogan Makes Sting Worship Him: Hogan and Eric Bischoff are in the ring, they run down Sting, who pops up from under the ring, then kneels before them and bows. The real Sting drops from the rafters and gives the Scorpion Death Drop to Eric then the fake Sting. Hogan gets the NWO to come out and surround the ring, Sting then rises back up to the rafters.-6/2/97, Ric Flair vs. Scott Hall w/Syxx: This was at the time a PPV quality pairing but unfortunately it's a short contest. Flair uses his trademark chops on Hall and nails Syxx a few times,  Scott takes over hammering him down, Syxx gets a few shots in behind the referee's back. Ric comes back chopping both men and at the knee of Hall, there's more interference and Scott hits Ric with a title belt and the ref calls for a DQ. 6/10, cause of the constant interfering. Steve "Mongo" McMichael and Jeff Jarrett run off Hall and Syxx.-6/16/97, Hollywood Hogan & Dennis Rodman Call Out Lex Luger & The Giant: Hogan and Rodman are in the ring, where they call out Luger and Giant, they go to leave and the big men come to the ring. Rodman attacks the Giant with the World Title, then the NWO hits the ring as the fans litter the ring with everything.-6/30/97, Rey Mysterio vs. Kevin Nash: Rey came out with some quick dropkicks and a spring board kick that knocks the big man down, Nash however uses his power and just beats down Mysterio, using a huge throw that brings the crowd to its feet. We have a Jacknife Powerbomb and a cover to win easily. 4/10, Nash hits two more Powerbombs and Konnan hits the ring and Nash leaves. Konnan attacks Rey's knee and the NWO has a new member.-7/7/97, La Parka vs. "Macho Man" Randy Savage: Interesting match up here, though WCW seemed more interested in pushing the tension between Larry Zbyszko and the NWO. Savage does a couple of nice arm drags, La Parka counters the elbow drop and hits the Diamond Cutter. He takes the mask off and it's DDP and he covers Savage to win. 5/10, for the shock.-9/22/97, Goldberg vs. Hugh Morrus: A rookie named Goldberg faces a guy with some size to him in Hugh Morrus, Goldberg does get a nice leg lock, Hugh even hits his No Laughing Matter Moonsault, but Goldberg kicks out. He then hits a couple of powerslams, then the Jackhammer and covers to win. 4/10, Gene Okerlund tries to get a word with Goldberg but he walks off.-10/6/97, Booker T w/Jacquelyn vs. Jeff Jarrett w/Debra: Long time fans will recognize Jacquelyn as the only woman to later hold the WWE Cruiserweight title (ugh what a bad moment), this match however isn't bad just fairly short. Some good wrestling mind you by both men, Jarrett taunts Booker early on, Booker hits some nice moves including a nice side kick. Jeff gets some shots in, but Booker comes back, Steve McMichael comes out and punches Jarrett, throwing him into the ring allowing Booker to get a roll-up for the win. 6/10.-11/3/97, Philadelphia Street Fight For The WCW Tag Team Championship, Steiner Brothers (Champions) vs. Public Enemy: From the old ECW stomping grounds in Philly, Public Enemy comes home and this is a brawl where everyone involved goes all out. This fight goes around ringside, into the crowd, to the entrance way where Rocco Rock hits a diving forearm off the Nitro set. Weapons like chairs, steel steps, tables, camera cables (which leads to some "static" occuring when they're used), Johnny Grunge misses a dive from the top through two tables and Scott Steiner covers to win. 7/10, though it was short.-11/10/97, N.W.O. Sings "O Canada": Eric Bischoff and the entire NWO come out and Nash  runs down the Giant on the mic. Eric even mentions Bret Hart (just days after the Montreal Screwjob) and everyone sings "O Canada".-12/15/97, Booker T vs. "Macho Man" Randy Savage: Not a bad one here, Booker shows he can hang with a main eventer, even working on Randy's arm for a bit while Savage resorted to dirty tactics, like using a chair to gain the advantage. At one point a fan even tries to get into the ring and Savage kicks him a couple of times, then afterwards the referee gets knocked down. Booker hits the Axe Kick, but Miss Elizabeth distracts him long enough to allow Randy to use a chair again. Savage hits the elbow and covers to win. 6/10.-12/22/97, Rey Mysterio, Juventud Guerrera & Hector Garza vs. Psicosis, Silver King & La Parka: There was another match involving these 6 on Rey's "Life of a Masked Man" DVD and like that one this was a fast paced. Lots of high flying moves, some good wrestling and being a fan of La Parka and Rey this was a fun match to watch. Just a ton of great spots that really shows why the Cruiserweights were such a huge part of WCW. Rey hits a Springboard Hurricarana on Silver King and covers to win. 8/10.-1/5/98, WCW United States Championship Match, Diamond Dallas Page (Champion) vs. Chris Jericho: We get an apology from Jericho to announcer Dave Penzer for throwing him off his chair last week. This match while not bad is just too short, I mean it's maybe 3 minutes long, there's some good moves, DDP hits a quick Diamond Cutter and covers to win. 5/10.-3/9/98, Hollywood Hogan, Kevin Nash & Scott Hall vs. Sting, "Macho Man" Randy Savage & The Giant: Given how each of these guys had matches at the upcoming PPV, this was little more than a tease of what was to come, though the star power does help. It was pretty much a brawl, Hogan's team targeted Giant's injured neck for a while. Once Savage is tagged in he takes it to Hogan, Nash runs to the back and the Giant follows. The Disciple comes in and hits Savage with the Apocalypse and Hulk covers to win. 6/10.-3/23/98, WCW World Heavyweight Championship Match, Sting (Champion) vs. Diamond Dallas Page: Since DDP was the U.S. champion at the time, he had the ultra rare chance to become a duel champ and like their other title match on the previous "Nitro" set, this was a great one and showed how good these two worked together. Great wrestling, close nearfalls and some big moves just add to the big match feel of this contest. Sting counters the Diamond Cutter and hits the Scorpion Death Drop and covers to win. 8/10.-4/20/98, Raven's Rules Match For The WCW United States Championship, Goldberg vs. Raven (Champion): Not a bad one here as being in these hardcore type matches helped mask Goldberg's lack experience at this point. Raven does get in some good shots with some weapons around ringside, members of the Flock come in to try to stop Goldberg. However he throws them out of the ring, hits the spear and Jackhammer on Raven and covers to win the title. 7/10.-5/4/98, Birth of the Wolfpac: During a match Nash, Konnan and Savage of the NWO Wolfpac come down to the ring and they talk about how they're gonna wage war on the NWO Hollywood. Curt Henning comes down and ends up joining the Wolfpac. Not a bad segment.Disc 2-6/1/98, Kevin Nash & Lex Luger vs. Hollywood Hogan & The Giant: Decent match here with a lot of star power, as the NWO Black and White faced the NWO Wolfpac. Good face/offs between all four, nice battle of the big men with Giant and Nash. Things break down and Hogan hits nash with the title belt to cause a DQ. 7/10, Sting comes from the rafters and reveals a NWO Black and White shirt, then decks Hogan and slams the Giant, he rips that shirt off joining the Wolfpac to a massive reaction.-9/28/98, Chris Jericho Meets The Real Goldberg: After weeks of taunting Goldberg, we have this face/off where Goldberg brings out the imposter Jericho used to "beat" him on a recent broadcast. He spears Chris' security and Jericho runs off. Decent segment.-12/21/98, Rey Mysterio vs. Eddie Guerrero: This was during the L.W.O. storyline and just before Eddie's car accident that put him out of action for months. These two always had good to great matches and while short this is no different. Rey hits some quick moves but gets launched into the guardrail and Eddie takes over for a few, working on the back and knee of Mysterio. However Rey does hit a nice dive to the outside on Guerrero and his bodyguard. The closing minutes are good with a few nearfalls and Kidman comes down and accidentaly hits Rey and Eddie rolls him up for three. 7/10.-1/25/99, Ladder Match For The Taser, Bam Bam Bigelow vs. Scott Hall w/Disco Inferno: We get the "Survey Says" promo from Scott and the object is to climb the ladder and get the taser to use it. They both make some good use of the ladder, especially Hall who had a couple of classics against Shawn Michaels a few years before this. Hall hits a nice dive off the top, slamming the ladder into Bam Bam, but Bigelow comes back hitting a diving headbutt off the ladder. Both take some more hard bumps off the ladder and Bigelow gets the taser, Goldberg runs in, grabs the tasers and spears both Bam Bam and Hall. 7/10, cause of the effort.-2/8/99, WCW United States Championship Match, Bret "Hit Man" Hart (Champion) vs. Rowdy Roddy Piper: Nearly 7 years after their classic at Wrestlemania VIII, we have this match where Bret had claimed he had a groin injury. This was the definition of a slugfest as there wasn't a ton of wrestling, at one point Bret fakes getting kicked in the groin which brings out the doctor to check on him. Hart jumps up quickly and takes over on Piper beating him down, then Bret attacks a "fan" who turns out to be MadTV actor Will Sasso (playing off an angle with Hart on a recent episode). A tussle with Sasso leads to Piper rolling Bret up for three to win the title. 5/10.-5/31/99, WCW World Tag Team Championship Match, Perry Saturn & Kanyon (Champion) vs. Diamond Dallas Page & Bam Bam Bigelow: After Saturn's tag partner Raven and then Kanyon were taken out by DDP and Bigelow, we have this handicap tag team title match. DDP and Bam Bam obviously use the numbers advantage, Saturn however uses a divide and conquer offense and does well at times. This was about how Saturn just wouldn't quit and almost overcame the odds, hitting two Death Valley Drivers, Kanyon comes down. He gets the tag, DDP hits a discus punch and covers to win the titles. 6/10.-7/12/99, No DQ WCW World Heavyweight Championship Match, "Macho Man" Randy Savage (Champion) vs. Hollywood Hogan: Not nearly as good as their Wrestlemania V face/off about a decade before, however it's not too bad as Savage was defending the title he won just 24 hours ago on PPV. There was even a fight between members of Team Madness at one point, both men did fight some outside the ring, a chair got used on both men, as did Hulk's belt. Savage misses his elbow drop, Hogan of course Hulk's up, Sid Vicious and Sting interfere and fight to the back. Nash comes down, Jacknife's Savage and Hulk covers to win the title. 6/10.-12/13/99, WCW World Tag Team Championship Match, Kevin Nash & Scott Hall vs. Goldberg & Bret "Hit Man" Hart (Champions): Before the match Bret is shown suffering the effects of an attack earlier in the night, Goldberg comes out and decides to fight both men. Goldberg hits some big power moves on both guys, Nash and Hall take over for a bit. Bret comes down to even the odds but Nash takes him out and covers him to win the titles. 5/10.-5/15/00, House of Pain Match, Sting vs. Vampiro: These two had a decent rivalry and I always enjoyed both of these characters especially Vampiro's, the idea was to beat your opponent down, handcuff them to the side of the cage then beat them up more. They throw each other into the steel cage some, beat each other up plenty and Sting ends up shackling to the cage wall and hitsa couple of Stinger Splashes then leaves. 6/10, for the star power.-2/26/01, Shane Helms vs. Shannon Moore: The former 3 Count members fight in this very short cruiserweight match, both hit some quick and high impact moves. There's interfence from Evan Karagias on Moore's behalf. Shane hits the Verta-Breaker and covers to win. 4/10, cause it's so short.-3/26/01, Title for Title Match, Scott Steiner (World Champion) vs. Booker T (U.S. Champion): From the final episode of Nitro we have this decent but nothing special contest, Steiner uses his strength and suplexed Booker some, while Booker hit some kicks and quick moves. It isn't a long match, which ends with Booker hitting the Book End and covering to become the final World champion in WCW's history. 5/10.Blu-ray Exclusive Matches-9/11/95, WCW World Heavyweight Championship Match, Hulk Hogan (Champion) vs. Lex Luger: A week before this match was made official (that moment is on the previous Nitro set) and this is a power vs. power contest in every sense of the word. Both men display some good wrestling, there's also the expected power moves, Luger slaps on the Torture Rack, but Hogan shockingly doesn't give up. Hulk hits the leg drop but the Dungeon of Doom members run in causing a DQ. 5/10, Sting and Savage come out to even the odds.-9/18/95, Ric Flair vs. Brian Pillman: After costing Flair a match the night before we have this good but short contest, there's chops by Ric, dirty tactics by both men and it's a pretty hard hitting match. Pillman works on the right arm of Flair, hammering it into the ring post and guardrail, Brian misses a splash from the top and they trade chops. The Figure Four is on and Pillman taps out. 6/10. Flair calls out Arn Anderson saying he will get him next week.-10/21/96, J.L. vs. N.W.O. Sting: Members of the N.W.O. are at ringside, "Sting" hits some moves and slaps on the Scorpion Death Lock, the real Sting comes down, hitting some moves on "Sting" then the N.W.O. comes into the ring. Ted DiBiase and Nash talks up how great it would be if he joined them, Sting basically says that nothing is for sure and he walks off. 5/10, as it was just a segment.-3/16/98, Sting & Lex Luger vs. Hollywood Hogan & "Macho Man" Randy Savage: Taking place with a pool around the ringside area, Sting makes his entrance by lowering down from a helicopter. There was also bad blood between Savage and Hogan, so Randy is tossed into the ring and beaten up by Sting and Luger. Savage ends up tagging Hogan and he takes over on Luger, Sting comes and all four get in the ring. The Disciple comes in and causes a DQ, 6/10. Members of the N.WO. come in and Hogan and Savage fight around the ring.-6/15/98, Steel Cage Match, Diamond Dallas Page vs. "Macho Man" Randy Savage, Special Guest Referee "Rowdy" Roddy Piper: The rivalry these two had was great and this was another good bout, they both make good use of the cage. DDP sends Savage into the cage wall hurting Macho's knee, Randy does take over working on the ribs of DDP. Savage even attacks Piper hitting a piledriver, DDP hits the Diamond Cutter, after DDP hits Piper the Rowdy one goes nuts. He sends them both into the cage wall, the cage starts raising and the N.W.O. comes into beat them up. 7/10, Sting climbs the roof and the Wolfpac members come down to even the odds.-9/14/98, WCW World Heavyweight Championship Match, Goldberg (Champion) vs. Sting: Big time main event here with two of WCW's finest, the crowd was fired up big time, both men hit some high impact moves. Goldberg even gets a nice leg lock on out of nowhere but Sting gets to the ropes, Sting ends up taking over hitting 3 Stinger Splashes and dodges the Spear. The Scorpion Deathlock is on, Hogan comes down and kicks Sting in the head but the referee doesn't see it. Goldberg hits the Spear and Jackhammer and covers to win. 7/10. Bret Hart chases Hogan off.-2/1/99, WCW World Television Championship Match, Scott Steiner (Champion) w/Buff Bagwell vs. Chris Jericho: Power vs. speed match-up here, we get a pre-match promo from Scott as he runs down DDP (whom he'd had run-ins with previously) and DDP's wife Kimberly. Steiner starts with some good wrestling and power moves including a big press slam, Jericho does come back hitting his patented springboard dropkick sending Scott to the outside. Bagwell gets involved a couple of times, Scott keeps up the offense and thwarts Chris' efforts to come back. Saturn comes out (whom had been feuding with Jericho), throws him in the ring, Scott slaps on the Steiner Recliner and Jericho gives up so Steiner wins. 6/10.-3/15/99, Ric Flair & Goldberg vs. Hollywood Hogan & Kevin Nash: Flair was the President of WCW, got in Goldberg's face about starting the match and got a press slam as a result. Ric gets beat up by both Nash and Hogan early on, Goldberg gets the tag and takes it Hogan. Nash hits some good moves too, Hogan and Flair face off, Hulk hits the legdrop but Charles Robinson won't count and he gets knocked down. Goldberg hits the spear and the match just ends. 6/10, for what's shown.-11/22/99, Jeff Jarrett Reclaims His World Heavyweight Championship: Bret Hart is in the ring with the WCW World Championship, he talks up how he won the title and how if Goldberg wants a shot he can have one. Nash and Hall come out and Hall cuts a promo running down Hart, Nash cuts his own too and they make a tag match with them vs. Goldberg and Hart. Jeff Jarrett comes behind Bret and hits him with a guitar and takes the World Title belt.-DDP and "Macho Man" Randy Savage's War of Words: We see a montage of clips showing how great of a rivalry these two had in WCW great stuff here.One thing I liked was how DDP took time to talk about two of his fallen friends, Bam Bam Bigelow and especially "Macho Man" Randy Savage, both were touching though the one for Randy was heart wrenching as you could tell DDP really appreciated all Savage did for him. The set itself has much more good than bad and if you're a WCW fan this is a great set to have along with the first Nitro Volume.
summary: Better than the very good first volume

reviewText: I'm a wwe fan all the way, but was always interested in wcw's nitro. The DVD is a must have for wrestling fans. As you know this was the hottest time in wrestling history with the monday night wars going on. The matches were ok, and nothing really stood out. They're was a lot of run ins. To be honest I was expecting more from this and I personally felt like this DVD was boring. That's just my opinion. I like wwe better and always have. They could of had so many extra's on a set like this for fans, but of course they don't. The one's they do have are already on other DVD's.

reviewText: being the huge wrestling fan that i am this was a must buy for me! i was really into the WCW in the 1990's with iconic superstars like "Goldberg","kevin nash","scott hall","sting",hollyhood hogan" and "randy savage" even though most of their superstarss came from the WWF.this volume of "the best of WCW" is a great addition to the "best of WCW volume 1" this has some very great matches to offer.for instance,their is the great clash between the near 300lb arguably strongest WCW wrestler of all time "goldberg" and the icon "sting"if you were a RAW fan in the the Monday night war or even with WCW this is the dvd for you! 4 out of 5

reviewText: Glad to see we got more of Nitro as the first set just scratched the surface.  I'm sure they could release even more.  Lots of great talent on Nitro and I wish more of those further down the roster than those up at Championship level (same old guys not giving their best there).  Let's hope more gets released for WCW & other promotions & even more of WWE's past as well (how about Attitude Era vol. 2?).

reviewText: The sequel to 2011's Best Of Monday Nitro complilation DVD is a disapointment for WCW and wrestling fans in general.  There were so many memorable matches on this program that got short thrift, obviously you cant fit everything onto the first collection but there is so much missing here it's disheartening. Much of what is here, match wise, while entertaining, isnt noteworthy.Some Important Nitro Matches that should have been included...Hogan vs Giant (Feb 98) ... Giant's Initial World Title Win vs Ric Flair (April 96), Loser Leaves WCW Match between Giant vs Kevin Nash (Feb 99), Goldberg vs Flair (March 99), Flair's last World Title win vs Jeff Jarrett (May 2000), Ric Flair/Arn Anderson vs Rock & Roll Express (May 96), Brett Hart vs Lex Luger (99), didnt Goldberg face Sting for the WCW Title on Nitro ?On the plus side, there are some entertaining if not as famous matches with Randy Savage and a short tribute. The side bars on WCW productions and Nitro parties, etc are ineresting. DDP was a good choice as host although I would have chosen one his matches during his run as World Champ since he is the de facto host.Ultimately, it seems as if the biggest stars of the company (Goldberg, Sting, Flair, Giant) are not well represented.Maybe what they should have done is assemble two or three matches each for the biggest stars of the program (Hogan, Nash, NwO as a team, Flair, Sting, Luger, Steiner, Savage, Goldberg, Giant, DDP) and spotlight The Cruiserweights separately. You might have gotten a better match selection then, wrapped around the some of the memorable promos, the vignettes on Nitro Parties & WCW Production, etc.
summary: Some Cool Stuff, But Not The Best
